name: Insert a new user
sql: INSERT INTO Users (username, password, email) VALUES ('testuser', 'password123', 'testuser@example.com');
rationale: Testing user creation ensures the system can store new entries and manage unique constraints.

name: Update a user's email
sql: UPDATE Users SET email = 'newemail@example.com' WHERE username = 'testuser';
rationale: Validating email updates verifies that existing users can modify their contact information.

name: Insert a new department
rationale: Creating a new department with a manager checks the integrity of foreign key relationships.

name: Insert a new product
sql: INSERT INTO Products (name, description, price, stock_quantity) VALUES ('Widget', 'A useful widget', 19.99, 100);
rationale: Adding products tests the functionality for inventory management.

name: Create a new order
sql: INSERT INTO Orders (user_id, status, total) VALUES (1, 'Pending', 39.98);
rationale: Testing order creation is crucial to validate the purchasing flow from users.

name: Insert a new user with existing username
sql: INSERT INTO Users (username, password, email) VALUES ('testuser', 'password456', 'different@example.com');
rationale: This tests the system's ability to enforce unique constraints on usernames.

name: Update a user's email to an existing email
sql: UPDATE Users SET email = 'testuser@example.com' WHERE username = 'anotheruser';
rationale: Verifying the handling of duplicate email entries ensures data integrity across the user table.

name: Insert a department with a non-existent manager
rationale: This tests the system's foreign key constraints when the referenced user does not exist.

name: Insert a product with negative stock quantity
sql: INSERT INTO Products (name, description, price, stock_quantity) VALUES ('Fragile Widget', 'A fragile widget', 29.99, -10);
rationale: Testing for negative stock quantity ensures the system properly validates inventory entries.

name: Create an order with a non-existent user
sql: INSERT INTO Orders (user_id, status, total) VALUES (999, 'Pending', 59.99);
rationale: This checks if the system properly enforces foreign key constraints when the user doesn't exist.
